definition: to lead to/to draw to/to steer towards

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
surname Xiang
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly

sentences.english: Grisly slayings brings Mexican drug war to US.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖的屠杀将毒品大战从墨西哥引向美国。

sentences.english: Inbreeding seen to bring down Spain's Habsburgs.
sentences.chinese: 近亲结婚将将西班牙哈普斯堡皇室引向衰退。

sentences.english: It is hoped that these efforts will promote the studies of China's chieftain system .
sentences.chinese: 只有这样才能把中国土司制度的研究引向深入。

sentences.english: The temptations of the big city soon led him astray.
sentences.chinese: 大城市里的种种诱惑很快把他引向邪路。

sentences.english: Have you beauty, that leads the heart from things fashioned of wood and stone to the holy mountain?
sentences.chinese: 你们可有美，那将心灵从木石之所引向圣山的向导？

sentences.english: The main spiral staircase depicts a rhythmic ribbon that ascends to attic space.
sentences.chinese: 主旋转楼梯像一条螺旋上升的缎带将空间引向顶楼。

sentences.english: That brings me to your second question.
sentences.chinese: 这就把我引向了您的第二个问题。

sentences.english: It’s a simple courtesy and leads to a relaxed conversation.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个基本的礼貌，这样能够引向轻松的谈话。

sentences.english: The road will lead you up to the gate of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 这条路会把你们引向花园的大门。

sentences.english: The honeyguide is a bird that leads humans to bee colonies.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种能把人引向蜂巢的鸟。

sentences.english: My God, I know that you always give me good.
sentences.chinese: 心真的飘远，真的不知道命运会把我引向什么方向。

sentences.english: What guides you toward simple living?
sentences.chinese: 什么将你引向更简单的生活？

sentences.english: I did not want to add to his troubles or to lead him into more danger.
sentences.chinese: 我不想再给他添麻烦或者把他引向更危险的处境。

sentences.english: Lure lamp lured mosquitoes and insects.
sentences.chinese: 引诱灯的作用是把蚊虫引向灭蚊灯。

sentences.english: A house-shaped doorway provides the building's entrance, leading directly into the atrium.
sentences.chinese: 建筑的入口是一个房屋形状的门洞，直接地引向庭院。

sentences.english: A mouse leads a clandestine life below the ground.
sentences.chinese: 一只耗子能够引向地底之下的秘密生命。

definition: to point towards/aimed at/facing/the direction indicated
to extract/to draw out
spearhead/barb/an attack or criticism
to extend the scope/to exaggerate
to drag in
to pull into/to draw in
to regard as
to drive away
attention
to disrupt/to throw into disorder
to lead to
to place/to put (at or in a position)/to be located
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to look upon as/to regard as
one divides into two/to be two-sided/there are two sides to everything/to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
